question: what is northern light (meaning)
answer: The Northern Lights, or Aurora Borealis, are a natural light display in the Arctic sky. They appear when charged particles from the sun collide with gases in Earth’s atmosphere, creating waves of light that move and change shape. They are most often green, but can also appear in purple, pink or red. Lapland is one of the best places in the world to see them.

question: Do you have availability for tonight/tomorrow? How can I check if there are seats left?
answer: Availability depends on the date and tour type. For the fastest confirmation, check the booking page for your selected tour/date. If you want us to check for you, send your preferred date, number of people, and tour type, and we will confirm availability if possible.

question: What if we are late for the pickup/meeting time? Can you wait?
answer: If you are running late, contact us as soon as possible. We will do our best to advise, but we may not be able to delay the schedule significantly because the route is planned for the whole group and conditions can change quickly.

question: What time do the Northern Lights usually appear? Is there a peak time?
answer: There is no fixed peak time—the Northern Lights are a natural phenomenon and can appear at any time during the night when conditions are right. We plan the route and timing using real-time aurora and weather data to maximize your chances.

question: Can I cancel and get a refund if I booked via GetYourGuide?
answer: If you booked through GetYourGuide, cancellation and refund handling is primarily managed by GetYourGuide according to their policy (including deadlines). Please contact GetYourGuide customer support for cancellations, refund eligibility, and timing. If you share your booking reference, we can still help confirm your tour details and the latest operational instructions.

question: Can I get a refund if I’m past the cancellation deadline on GetYourGuide?
answer: For GetYourGuide bookings, refund decisions after the deadline are made by GetYourGuide under their policy. Please contact GetYourGuide customer support and provide your booking details.

question: I was charged on GetYourGuide but my booking was not confirmed. What should I do?
answer: If your payment was deducted on GetYourGuide but the booking did not confirm, this must be handled by GetYourGuide support because payments are processed on their platform. Please contact GetYourGuide customer support and share your payment/booking details.

question: Can Lapland Explorers manage my GetYourGuide payment or booking issues?
answer: We are a supplier on GetYourGuide and we do not process GetYourGuide payments directly. For payment issues, booking confirmation issues, or platform-side changes, you need to contact GetYourGuide customer support.

question: My tour was cancelled. How does the refund work if I booked via GetYourGuide?
answer: If you booked via GetYourGuide and the tour is cancelled, the cancellation/refund flow is handled in GetYourGuide. In many cases you need to accept the cancellation in GetYourGuide, after which GetYourGuide processes the refund according to their system and policy.

question: I can’t see your message in GetYourGuide / my ticket didn’t update after changes. What should I do?
answer: Sometimes GetYourGuide messages or ticket details may not appear immediately after changes. Please follow the latest instructions we send (via GetYourGuide messaging and/or WhatsApp). If you share your GetYourGuide booking reference, we can confirm your current schedule and resend the information.

question: If a refund is approved for a GetYourGuide booking, how is it paid back?
answer: If you booked via GetYourGuide and a refund is approved, GetYourGuide processes the refund back to the same payment method/card used for the booking (according to their system).

question: Can I add more people to my GetYourGuide booking (e.g., add one more friend)?
answer: GetYourGuide bookings cannot always be modified by us. If you need an additional spot, the simplest option is usually to book an extra seat separately (for example via our website). We will provide the latest meeting/pick-up instructions before the tour.

question: Can you confirm my GetYourGuide booking is still valid?
answer: Yes. Please send your GetYourGuide booking reference code and the booking name, and we can confirm that your booking is in place and verify the latest instructions.

question: How can I confirm whether my tour is actually with Lapland Explorers (and not another operator)?
answer: Send your booking reference and the platform you booked through (for example GetYourGuide). We can confirm whether your reservation is with Lapland Explorers and provide the correct instructions.

question: Is it better to book directly on your website or via GetYourGuide?
answer: Booking directly on our website is often simpler for us to manage and may offer better pricing. Some guests still prefer GetYourGuide due to their own discounts, bundles, or platform preference.

question: Do you have a discount code or campaign price?
answer: We sometimes run campaigns for selected products. If you have a promo code, you can use it on our website during checkout. If you don’t have one, you can ask us if there is a currently active campaign.

question: When will we receive our tour photos, and how will they be sent?
answer: Photos are delivered after editing and are typically shared as a download link (often by email). In many cases delivery happens within a few days; depending on workload/season it can take longer (for example around 4–7 days). If you booked via GetYourGuide, the link may also be shared via the GetYourGuide chat depending on the booking flow. We send the link as soon as the photos are ready.

question: Can you send the photo link via WhatsApp or to multiple email addresses?
answer: Yes—if needed, we can share the photo download/album link via WhatsApp, and we can also send it to the email address(es) you provide. Please ensure the email addresses are correct.

question: Can you send our tour photos as a photo album link (for example a Google Drive folder)?
answer: Yes. We can share edited photos as a photo album link (for example a Google Drive folder). If needed, we can also send the album link via WhatsApp.

question: I didn’t receive the confirmation/photo email. What should I do?
answer: Please check your spam/junk/trash folders first. If you still cannot find the message, send your booking reference (and the tour date/name) and the email address you want us to use, and we will confirm the correct delivery details.

question: I’m not satisfied with the photo quality—what can I do?
answer: Please contact us with your booking reference and (if possible) share 1–2 example images you are referring to. This helps us review the specific case accurately and advise the best next step.

question: Someone asked my name at pick-up—how do I make sure I’m getting into the correct vehicle?
answer: Before getting in, confirm the company name (Lapland Explorers), the guide/driver name if provided, and the vehicle description (for example a van/minivan). If anything feels unclear, message or call us immediately and ask the driver what company they represent.

question: How do we recognize the driver/guide at the pick-up point?
answer: Drivers may not always have a uniform. If needed, we can help you locate the vehicle by confirming where it is and what it looks like. If there is confusion, you can also share a photo of your exact location so we can guide the driver to you quickly.

question: My pick-up time has passed. Where is the driver/van and what should I do?
answer: Minor delays can happen due to route logistics and locating other guests. Please stay ready at the agreed pick-up location and keep your phone available. If you message us, we can check the driver’s status and share an updated ETA when possible.

question: Do you do pick-ups outside Rovaniemi (for example 19–40 km away)?
answer: Standard pick-ups are typically within about a 10 km range of Rovaniemi city center. If you are farther away (for example 19–40 km), pick-up may still be possible for an extra fee depending on distance and schedule, and we confirm it case-by-case. Please share your hotel name and location/address so we can confirm the best option (pick-up or an agreed meeting point in Rovaniemi).

question: Why are you messaging me about pick-up if I already cancelled?
answer: Sometimes a cancelled booking can still appear temporarily in internal lists due to system synchronization delays. If you believe you cancelled, share your booking details and we will verify the current status.

question: Can my small child sit on a lap during the tour (to avoid booking a seat)?
answer: No. All children must have their own reserved seat for safety and compliance. Lap seating is not allowed.

question: Can a 2-year-old (toddler) join the Northern Lights hunting tour?
answer: In many cases, a long Northern Lights hunting tour is not suitable for very small children because it may involve long driving, late hours, and cold conditions. Please contact us with the child’s age and your booking details so we can advise what is possible.

question: We have our own child car seat—can kids join then?
answer: Having your own child seat does not automatically make the tour suitable for very small children. On long aurora hunts with extensive driving and late hours, we may still not be able to take very young children due to safety and the nature of the tour.

question: I have a remaining balance to be refunded. When will it be processed and will I get a receipt/confirmation?
answer: If there is a remaining balance to be refunded, we can confirm the refund amount and provide confirmation/receipt once the refund is initiated. Refund timing depends on the payment method/provider/platform.

question: What is the Guaranteed Northern Lights Bus Tour, and what does it cost in different seasons?
answer: The Guaranteed Northern Lights Bus Tour is a 57-seater coach tour with a 6-hour time limit and a maximum of 54 passengers. It includes a money-back guarantee and professional photos. Meeting time is between 18:00 and 21:00 at the meeting pont. Bus tour don't include hotel pickup.

question: What is the Private Guaranteed Northern Lights Hunt?
answer: The Private Guaranteed Northern Lights Hunt is a premium private aurora-hunting product with a private ride (Mercedes Sprinter or minivan). It includes professional photos and follows a money-back guarantee / reschedule approach if the aurora is not seen. Typical duration is 5–12 hours, and food or champagne can be arranged on request.

question: What is the Private Forest Campfire Experience?
answer: The Private Forest Campfire Experience is a 5-hour private experience near Rovaniemi that includes sauna, a campfire and traditional flamed salmon. The price shown is 899€.

question: What is the Lapland Activity Park experience?
answer: The Activity Park at Lapland (Ranua) is a private experience that includes transfer from accommodation in Rovaniemi. The price shown is 1,150€ for 2 adults + 2 children, including meal and transport (noted as max 100 km one way). The description lists seasonal activities such as reindeer sleigh ride (500 m), animal feeding, sauna, ice skating, snowmobile and other activities (season-dependent).

question: What are Santa’s Husky Rides and what is the price range?
answer: Santa’s Husky Rides are shared husky rides with self-driving options, with ride lengths as 1–18 km. The price range shown is 60–290€ per person depending on the length and whether it is shared/self-driving. Winter clothing is included, and pickup & drop-off is included as within 10 km. Photos are taken with your own device/phone.

question: Do you need entry tickets for Santa Claus Village Visit?
answer: The price list notes that Santa Claus Village Visit does not require entry tickets.

question: Do you offer chauffeur service and how is it priced?
answer: Chauffeur service is listed, with pricing described as depending on the time of the month and the location.

question: Do you offer transportation services (e.g., airport transport) and how is it priced?
answer: Transportation services (including airport transportation) are listed, with pricing depending on the time of the month and the location. Pricing is provided after a request. The list also notes transport anywhere within Lapland and that Helsinki–Rovaniemi transportation is possible.

question: How does your money-back guarantee work (naked eye vs camera)?
answer: Our promise is a real money-back guarantee: if we don’t see the Northern Lights with the naked eye or on camera, you’ll receive a full refund. Please note an important exception on bright moon nights: with half moon or brighter, Northern Lights may not be visible to the naked eye and only our camera guarantee applies—if the lights are visible on camera, it is counted as a successful observation (no eye guarantee).

question: Is smoking, alcohol, or drugs allowed during the tour?
answer: No. Smoking in the vehicle is not allowed, and alcohol and drugs are not allowed on the tour.

question: Where is the meeting point for the Bus Tour?
answer: The meeting point is Rovakatu 25–27 (Lapland Explorers Office) in Rovaniemi. For the Bus Tour, pickup and drop-off are handled at the selected meeting point in Rovaniemi.

question: I have a booking today — what time will you pick us up?
